sen.j: 一竿子 忠綱（いっかんし ただつな）は、江戸時代元禄期頃の摂津国の刀工。
sen.e: Ikkanshi Tadatsuna was a sword craftsman in the Settsu Province who lived in the Genroku era during the Edo period.
Ikkanshi Tadatsuna was a sword craftsman in the Settsu Province who lived in the Genroku era during the Edo period.
Ikkanshi Tadatsuna was a sword craftsman in the Settsu Province who lived in the Genroku era during the Edo period.

sen.j: 二代近江守忠綱。
sen.e: He was the second Omi no kami Tadatsuna.
He was the second Omi no kami (Governor of Omi Province) Tadatsuna.
sen.cmt: 近江守の説明としてセルＣの用語を追加しました。
sen.e: He was the second Omi no kami (Governor of Omi Province) Tadatsuna.

sen.j: 新刀上々作にして良業物。
sen.e: His swords were categorized into Shinto (new sword), Jojosaku (the second rank) (上々作) and Yokiwazamono (the third grade of sharpness).
His swords were categorized into Shinto (new sword), Jojosaku (the second rank) (上々作) and Yokiwazamono (the third grade of sharpness).
His swords were categorized into Shinto (new sword), Jojosaku (the second rank) (上々作) and Yokiwazamono (the third grade of sharpness).

sen.j: 氏は浅井氏で、通称は「万太夫」と伝わる（万太夫銘の作はない）。
sen.e: His surname was the Asai clan (浅井) and his common name was said to be 'Mandayu' (万太夫) (There is no sword with an inscription of Mandayu).
sen.cmt: 「浅井」、「万太夫」の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His surname was the Asai clan (浅井) and his common name was said to be 'Mandayu' (万太夫) (There is no sword with an inscription of Mandayu).
His surname was the Asai clan (浅井) and his common name was said to be 'Mandayu' (万太夫) (There is no sword with an inscription of Mandayu).

sen.j: 「一竿子」は号で、寳永、元禄頃の刀身彫りが施されている作の銘に主に使われている。
sen.e: The word 'Ikkanshi' refer to the go (byname) and was used for the swords with the curving of blade as inscription which were produced around the Kanei and Genroku eras.
The word 'Ikkanshi' refer to the go (byname) and was used for the swords with the curving of blade as inscription which were produced around the Kanei and Genroku eras.
The word 'Ikkanshi' refer to the go (byname) and was used for the swords with the curving of blade as inscription which were produced around the Kanei and Genroku eras.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の刀工である京の粟田口国綱の末裔を名乗り、父である忠綱が大阪へ移住。
sen.e: His father Tadatsuna identified himself as a descendant of Kunitsuna AWATAGUCHI who was a sword craftsman in Kyoto in the Kamakura period and moved to Osaka.
His father Tadatsuna identified himself as a descendant of Kunitsuna AWATAGUCHI who was a sword craftsman in Kyoto in the Kamakura period and moved to Osaka.
His father Tadatsuna identified himself as a descendant of Kunitsuna AWATAGUCHI who was a sword craftsman in Kyoto in the Kamakura period and moved to Osaka.

sen.j: 初代忠綱は近江守を受領。
sen.e: The first Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami (the governor of Omi Province).
The first Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami (the governor of Omi Province).
The first Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami (the governor of Omi Province).

sen.j: 弟子に長綱がいる。
sen.e: Nagatsuna was his disciple.
Nagatsuna was his disciple.
Nagatsuna was his disciple.

sen.j: 二代忠綱も父と同じく近江守を受領する。
sen.e: The second Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami as well as his father.
The second Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami as well as his father.
The second Tadatsuna was assigned to Omi no kami as well as his father.

sen.j: よって、父子で「粟田口近江守忠綱」を刻銘する。
sen.e: Therefore, both father and son carved the inscription of 'Awataguchi Omi no kami Tadatsuna.'
Therefore, both father and son carved the inscription of 'AWATAGUCHI Omi no kami Tadatsuna.'
sen.cmt: 粟田口を大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, both father and son carved the inscription of 'AWATAGUCHI Omi no kami Tadatsuna.'

sen.j: 初代の晩年作には二代と銘ぶりが似ているものもあり、二代の手が加わっているものと考えられている。
sen.e: Some inscriptions of the first Tadatsuna's work in his later years are similar to those of the second Tadatsuna's, so that it is thought that those were made by both of them.
Some inscriptions of the first Tadatsuna's work in his later years are similar to those of the second Tadatsuna's, so that it is thought that those were made by both of them.
Some inscriptions of the first Tadatsuna's work in his later years are similar to those of the second Tadatsuna's, so that it is thought that those were made by both of them.

sen.j: 初代と二代の銘の主な違いは「綱」にあり、「糸偏」の切り鏨の角度が異なる。
sen.e: The major difference of the inscriptions between the first and the second was a letter of 'Tsuna;' the angle of 'itohen' (a part of kanji) which was gadded was different.
The major difference of the inscriptions between the first and the second was a letter of 'Tsuna;' the angle of 'itohen' (a part of kanji) which was gadded was different.
The major difference of the inscriptions between the first and the second was a letter of 'Tsuna;' the angle of 'itohen' (a part of kanji) which was gadded was different.

sen.j: 二代の初期には初代と似た作風である足長丁子を焼いた。
sen.e: At first, the second Tadatsuna produced Ashinagachoji (a name of a sword) (足長丁子) which style resembled that of the first.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「足長丁子」の定訳不明です。
sen.e: At first, the second Tadatsuna produced Ashinagachoji (a name of a sword) (足長丁子) which style resembled that of the first.
At first, the second Tadatsuna produced Ashinagachoji (a name of a sword) (足長丁子) which style resembled that of the first.

sen.j: 元禄頃から津田越前守助広に私淑した涛瀾乱れや沸匂深い井上真改風の直刃を焼き、自身彫りを見る。
sen.e: Around the Genroku era, he began to produce Toran midare (a temper pattern) (涛瀾乱れ) influenced by Tuda Echizen no kami (the governor of the Echizen Province) Sukehiro and Suguha (a temper pattern)(直刃) with nie (grainy martensite) and nioi (fine-grained martensite) like the style of Shinkai INOUE, and finally started carving by himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「涛瀾乱れ」、「直刃」の定訳不明です。
sen.e: Around the Genroku era, he began to produce Toran midare (a temper pattern) (涛瀾乱れ) influenced by Tsuda Echizen no kami (the governor of the Echizen Province) Sukehiro and Suguha (a temper pattern)(直刃) with nie (grainy martensite) and nioi (fine-grained martensite) like the style of Shinkai INOUE, and finally started carving by himself.

Around the Genroku era, he began to produce Toran midare (a temper pattern) (涛瀾乱れ) influenced by Tsuda Echizen no kami (the governor of the Echizen Province) Sukehiro and Suguha (a temper pattern)(直刃) with nie (grainy martensite) and nioi (fine-grained martensite) like the style of Shinkai INOUE, and finally started carving by himself.

sen.j: 刀身彫りには従来からある剣巻龍だけでなく、梅倶利伽羅や鯉の滝登り等、元禄の華を感じさせる濃密な彫りのある作品が多い。
sen.e: Many works have a dense carving on the body of blade which reminds the prosperity of Genroku era such as Umekurikara (梅倶利伽羅) and Koi no Takinobori (A carp swimming up a fall) other than old Kenmakiryu (剣巻龍).
sen.cmt: 「梅倶利伽羅」、「剣巻龍」の定訳不明です。
sen.e: Many works have a dense carving on the body of blade which reminds the prosperity of Genroku era such as Umekurikara (梅倶利伽羅) and Koi no Takinobori (A carp swimming up a fall) other than old Kenmakiryu (剣巻龍).

Many works have a dense carving on the body of blade which reminds the prosperity of Genroku era such as Umekurikara (梅倶利伽羅) and Koi no Takinobori (A carp swimming up a fall) other than old Kenmakiryu (剣巻龍).

sen.j: 彫り物がある場合は、必ず茎に「彫同作」、「彫物同作」等と添銘を切る。
sen.e: The inscriptions of the sword with carving are usually put on nagomi (a part of the blade in hilt) as 'hori dousaku' (彫同作) or 'horimono dousaku' (彫物同作).
sen.cmt: 「彫同作」、「彫物同作」の定訳不明です。
sen.e: The inscriptions of the sword with carving are usually put on nagomi (a part of the blade in hilt) as 'hori dousaku' (彫同作) or 'horimono dousaku' (彫物同作).
The inscriptions of the sword with carving are usually put on nagomi (a part of the blade in hilt) as 'hori dousaku' (彫同作) or 'horimono dousaku' (彫物同作).

sen.j: 造り込み
sen.e: Tsukurikomi (cross-section form)
Tsukurikomi (cross-section form)
Tsukurikomi (cross-section form)

sen.j: - 脇差、2尺１寸前後の大刀が多い。
sen.e: Most of them are short sword and long sword of about 63 cm long.
Most of them are short sword and long sword of about 63 cm long.
Most of them are short sword and long sword of about 63 cm long.

sen.j: 踏ん張りが付き先反りのつく、前時代の寛文新刀と比較して優しい姿となる。
sen.e: They have a round shape with funbari (a kind of folding-fan shapes) and sakizori (warpage around the top), compared to Kanbun New Swords in the previous period.
They have a round shape with funbari (a kind of folding-fan shapes) and sakizori (warpage around the top), compared to Kanbun New Swords in the previous period.
They have a round shape with funbari (a kind of folding-fan shapes) and sakizori (warpage around the top), compared to Kanbun New Swords in the previous period.

sen.j: 切先が伸びた姿のものが多い。
sen.e: Most of their tips have sharp shape.
Most of their tips have sharp shape.
Most of their tips have sharp shape.

sen.j: 地鉄
sen.e: Jigane (ground metal)
Jigane (a body of iron blade)
sen.cmt: 地鉄（じがね）の定訳がないので、www.weblio.jp刀剣用語解説集（銀座長州屋提供）で調べた意味を英訳しました。
sen.e: Jigane (a body of iron blade)

sen.j: - 地鉄よく練れよく詰んだ、明るい大坂新刀の地鉄となる。
sen.e: Jigane was fine-grained and developed into a bright Osaka new sword.
Jigane was fine-grained and developed into a bright Osaka new sword.
Jigane was fine-grained and developed into a bright Osaka new sword.

sen.j: 小板目に杢目を交える。
sen.e: It is Slash-cut pattern with mokume (wood grain) pattern.
It is Slash-cut pattern with mokume (wood grain) pattern.
It is Slash-cut pattern with mokume (wood grain) pattern.

sen.j: 鎬時柾がかる。
sen.e: The part of Shinogi (the upper part of a timber that is cut diagonally on each side in order to form a peak) was 柾がかる.
sen.cmt: 「鎬時」は「鎬地」の誤記と判断しました。「柾がかる」の解釈不明です。
sen.e: The pattern of Shinogiji (a part of Mune-side [the other side of blade]) is grain with parallel growth rings.
sen.cmt: 鍋地が柾目（まさめ）となると解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: The pattern of Shinogiji (a part of Mune-side [the other side of blade]) is grain with parallel growth rings.

sen.j: 刃文
sen.e: Hamon (temper pattern of a sword blade)
Hamon (temper pattern of a sword blade)
Hamon (temper pattern of a sword blade)

sen.j: - 大坂焼き出しに焼き幅が鎬筋にかかる程広く、一定のリズムの互の目を交え、焼き幅が一定となるものを基本とする。
sen.e: It is basically Osaka yakidashi (a temper pattern around the root of blade) which is added with Gonome (regular wavelike pattern) of a broad regular width which could reach the line of ridge.
It is basically Osaka yakidashi (a temper pattern around the root of blade) which is added with Gonome (regular wavelike pattern) of a broad regular width which could reach the line of ridge.
It is basically Osaka yakidashi (a temper pattern around the root of blade) which is added with Gonome (regular wavelike pattern) of a broad regular width which could reach the line of ridge.

sen.j: 初期には足長丁子を焼き、壮年期には、直刃、涛瀾乱れに足長丁子を交えたものを焼く。
sen.e: At the beginning, he produced Ashinagachoji and in the prime of life he produced the swords of Suguha and Toran midare mixed with Ashinagachoji.
At the beginning, he produced Ashinagachoji (a name of Hamon) and in the prime of life he produced the swords of Suguha and Toran midare mixed with Ashinagachoji.
sen.cmt: 足長丁子（あしながちょうじ）が刃文の名称である説明を補足しました。
sen.e: At the beginning, he produced Ashinagachoji (a name of Hamon) and in the prime of life he produced the swords of Suguha and Toran midare mixed with Ashinagachoji.

sen.j: 彫り物がある場合は焼き幅が狭い。
sen.e: The width of blade of the sword with carving is narrow.
The width of blade of the sword with carving is narrow.
The width of blade of the sword with carving is narrow.

sen.j: 刃は沸出来で小沸が斑なくつき、刃中に砂流しが見られる。
sen.e: The blade has grainy martensite without any patch and Sunagashi (a pattern of martensite).
The blade has grainy martensite without any patch and Sunagashi (a pattern of martensite).
The blade has grainy martensite without any patch and Sunagashi (a pattern of martensite).

sen.j: 足長丁子を焼いた場合、足は長く、沸足の先の匂足は刃先に抜けるほどである。
sen.e: Ashikagacoji has a long temper pattern of nieashi and nioiashi (沸足の先の匂足は刃先に抜ける).
sen.cmt: 「沸足の先の匂足は刃先に抜ける」の解釈不明です。
sen.e: When Ashinagachoji is burned and produced, it shows long pattern and Nioiashi (a pattern with small grains) ahead of Nieashi (a pattern with large grains) seems to go through the tip of blade.
sen.cmt: 沸足（にえあし）は刃中に現れる大きな粒子の模様、匂足（においあし）は小さな粒子の模様のことです。定訳はないので説明を補足して訳しました。
sen.e: When Ashinagachoji is burned and produced, it shows long pattern and Nioiashi (a pattern with small grains) ahead of Nieashi (a pattern with large grains) seems to go through the tip of blade.

sen.j: 丁子の焼き頭同士に砂流しの沸働きが絡み、あたかも焼き頭が風船のように膨らんでいるに見える。
sen.e: Because of the effect of Sunagashi around the top of Ashinagachoji, it looks like having a bulge like a balloon.
Because of the effect of Sunagashi around the top of Ashinagachoji, it looks like having a bulge like a balloon.
Because of the effect of Sunagashi around the top of Ashinagachoji, it looks like having a bulge like a balloon.

sen.j: 帽子は直ぐに小丸で返り短い。
sen.e: Boshi (hamon around the top of sword) is komaru (小丸) and short.
sen.cmt: 「小丸」の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: The Hamon of Boshi (a tip of a sword) is Komaru, which shows small turning angle.
sen.cmt: 小丸帽子（こまるぼうし）と解釈し訳しました。
sen.e: The Hamon of Boshi (a tip of a sword) is Komaru, which shows small turning angle.

sen.j: 茎
sen.e: Nagomi
Nakago (a part to hold a sword)
sen.cmt: 「なかご」と読み、刀剣を手で持つところをさします。
sen.e: Nakago (a part to hold a sword)

sen.j: - 先細り片山形の刃上がり栗尻となる。
sen.e: The end is narrow and haagari kurijiri (刃上がり栗尻) with Katayama form (片山形).
sen.cmt: 「刃上がり栗尻」、「片山形」の読み方、定訳不明です。
sen.e: The shape of the tip of nakago is narrow and Katayamagata, Haagarikurishiri.
sen.cmt: 「なかご」の形を形容する言葉で、「はあがりくりしり」「かたやまがた」と読みます。
sen.e: The shape of the tip of nakago is narrow and Katayamagata, Haagarikurishiri.

sen.j: 鑢目筋違で化粧鑢を掛ける。
sen.e: It has a diagonal yasurime (a pattern of hilt) with kesho yasuri (designed yasuri).
It has a diagonal yasurime (a pattern of hilt) with kesho yasuri (designed yasuri).
It has a diagonal yasurime (a pattern of hilt) with kesho yasuri (designed yasuri).

sen.j: 棟地に小肉つく。
sen.e: It has a little thickness (小肉) on the part of Muneji (ridge).
Finishing Muneji (the other side of a blade) of Nagomi, a thick part of a sharp angle is slightly shaven and rounded off to make full to the touch.
sen.cmt: 「小肉がつく」とは、茎（なごみ）の棟地（むねじ）を仕立てる際に鋭い角の肉をわずかに落として丸みをつけることです。
sen.e: Finishing Muneji (the other side of a blade) of Nagomi, a thick part of a sharp angle is slightly shaven and rounded off to make full to the touch.

sen.j: 彫物
sen.e: Carving
Carving
Carving

sen.j: - 上述のような濃密な刀身彫りを見る。
sen.e: There is a dense carving on blade as mentioned above.
There is a dense carving on blade as mentioned above.
There is a dense carving on blade as mentioned above.

sen.j: 重要文化財に1振り指定されている（刀 銘「一竿子忠綱彫同作 宝永六年八月吉」、京都国立博物館蔵）。
sen.e: There is a sword which is designated to an important cultural property (the sword with the inscription 'Ikkanshi Tadatsuna hori dosaku, on a lucky day September, 1709,' held at the Kyoto National Museum).

There is a sword which is designated to an important cultural property (the sword with the inscription 'Ikkanshi Tadatsuna hori dosaku, on a lucky day September, 1709,' held at the Kyoto National Museum).

There is a sword which is designated to an important cultural property (the sword with the inscription 'Ikkanshi Tadatsuna hori dosaku, on a lucky day September, 1709,' held at the Kyoto National Museum).

sen.j: また、都道府県、市町村で文化財に指定されているものが多い。
sen.e: In addition, many works are designated to a cultural property by prefectural governments and municipal governments.
In addition, many works are designated to a cultural property by prefectural governments and municipal governments.
In addition, many works are designated to a cultural property by prefectural governments and municipal governments.

sen.j: 天明4年（1784年）3月24日に江戸城中で老中・田沼意次の子、若年寄・田沼意知を佐野善左衛門が暗殺した際に用いられたのが二代忠綱の大脇差と言う。
sen.e: It is said that Zenzaemon SANO killed wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) Okitomo TANUMA, a son of roju (senior councilor) Okitsugu TANUMA, at the Edo Castle on May 13, 1784 with a short sword of the second Tadatsuna.

It is said that Zenzaemon SANO killed wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) Okitomo TANUMA, a son of roju (senior councilor) Okitsugu TANUMA, at the Edo Castle on May 13, 1784 with a short sword of the second Tadatsuna.

It is said that Zenzaemon SANO killed wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) Okitomo TANUMA, a son of roju (senior councilor) Okitsugu TANUMA, at the Edo Castle on May 13, 1784 with a short sword of the second Tadatsuna.

sen.j: 当時、田沼時代と呼ばれるほどの権勢を誇り、収賄の悪名高かった田沼意次に一矢報いたことから、佐野は「世直し大明神」と崇められた。
sen.e: Since Sano fought back Okitsugu TANAMA who had such a great power as being called Tanuma period (the period when Okitsugu Tanuma led the government for about 20 years during the middle of the Edo period) and was famous for bribery, he was admired as 'Yonaoshi Daimyo-jin' (the Great God who reformed the world).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since Sano fought back Okitsugu TANUMA who had such a great power as being called Tanuma period (the period when Okitsugu Tanuma led the government for about 20 years during the middle of the Edo period) and was famous for bribery, he was admired as 'Yonaoshi Daimyo-jin' (the Great God who reformed the world).
sen.cmt: 一行目のTANUMAの誤字を直しました。
sen.e: Since Sano fought back Okitsugu TANUMA who had such a great power as being called Tanuma period (the period when Okitsugu Tanuma led the government for about 20 years during the middle of the Edo period) and was famous for bribery, he was admired as 'Yonaoshi Daimyo-jin' (the Great God who reformed the world).

sen.j: またその指料であった二代忠綱の刀も大いに人気を集めた。
sen.e: In addition, the sword of the second Tadatsuna which was his sashiryo (sword) became popular.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the sword of the second Tadatsuna which was his sashiryo (sword) became popular.
In addition, the sword of the second Tadatsuna which was his sashiryo (sword) became popular.
